chapter.title: LD persist across the life span
chapter.content:
LD persist across the life span

We have examined three of the six consensus statements; let’s move on to consensus statement #4. “LD persist across the life span.”

chapter.title: LD can have negative effects throughout life
chapter.content:
LD can have negative effects throughout life

LD begin in childhood and persist throughout the life span. LD can negatively affect learning, employment, interpersonal relationships and community integration. How this plays out developmentally can be very different. 

Life Phase LD Effects
Early Childhood Some individuals with LD have severe language problems, which are apparent during the preschool years.
Elementary School Others begin to struggle in elementary school and may miss a lot of school learning early on. These individuals are at risk of not developing the basic skills to benefit from the instruction provided throughout their school years.
High School Some individuals with LD are able to handle school learning in elementary grades but are unable to cope with the increased demands in secondary school, when their needs become apparent.
Adults For some adults, having a child diagnosed with LD helps them realize that they may have an undiagnosed LD. They see their own struggles in their child’s experiences.

chapter.title: Environments can affect the influence of LD
chapter.content:
Environments can affect the influence of LD

The reality is that LD do not go away. Learning problems apparent in school persist throughout life; only the environment changes.

Some environments can minimize the influence of the disability, while others can highlight the area or areas of need. An individual may learn to compensate for LD and may also strengthen an area of need, but that area will remain a relative challenge.

chapter.title: Environment is key to the success of adults with LD
chapter.content:
Environment is key to the success of adults with LD

For adults with LD, matching their profile of strengths and weaknesses with an appropriate learning environment and with appropriate employment is crucial.

chapter.title: More information on helping individuals with LD understand their strengths and weaknesses
chapter.content:
More information on helping individuals with LD understand their strengths and weaknesses

More information on how to help individuals with learning disabilities to understand and articulate their strengths and weaknesses can be found in the LINCS Self-Determination module of the Learning to Achieve online learning series.
